title: Great clinic
body: Not long wait for appointment, free parking, helpful and nice staff .......  ........................

title: Good service got an appointment at another surgery
body: I completed the online form at 8.15am for my little girl and got a call back the same day.   The surgery didn't have any appointments left so they organised one at an overflow surgery for the next day, Saturday. Great communication,  thanks.

title: Great practice
body:
I phoned up with a query about my elderly mother, hoping to see a nurse. The GP phoned back in a few minutes and invited us to come in straight away.
The GP was very helpful and informative and took time to answer our questions. We were very pleased with our experience and enjoyed meeting the doctor. The appointment was much better than expected, as I expected the staff to be busy and under pressure. We were not hurried by the staff at all.

title: Exceptionally kind, knowledgeable and caring…
body: From the reception staff to administrative queries and all of clinicians I have encountered to date have all been exceptional. The General practitioner that primarily has been responsible for my care has shown nothing but warmth, provided information, empowered mean to make decisions about appropriate treatments for me, has taken time to explain the various options and now I have absolutely no hesitation in trusting/respecting her opinions  when it comes to my son.  An absolute fantastic team who are always willing to go the extra mile. Everyone is always quick to be critical  and complain but I feel exceptionally fortunate to have found them as a practice that’s why  I’ve left a review.  I would absolutely recommend them to anyone looking for a practice in the Chiswick  area.

title: Not happy
body:
I'm getting increasingly frustrated with this surgery, to the point where I'm considering leaving it.

The receptionists don't seem to care.

I have has major eye surgery in one eye and have a thick cataract in the other.

Yet I'm not allowed to phone through for my prescriptions.

I have to cross a busy road, with about 30% vision to post my prescription in.

And then, to add insult to injury, for some unknown reason, this surgery has decided I don't need the medication that the specialist at the hospital has told me I need.

I say unknown, because no one at the surgery picked up the phone to tell me they wasn't putting it through.

I only found out when I went to pick up my prescriptions from the chemist.

I am very disappointed.

title: Absolutely Fantastic Service
body: Ward 8 are absolutely fantastic from start to finish. Every member of staff is committed to their role in the department. They work together as a team and achieve the best for their patients. They are a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Had to visit today after phone call. The dr I saw was lovely. Explained everything thoroughly and referred me on for further treatment. Always had good treatment here thank you

title: Always helpful and straight-to-the-point.
body:
Whatever the case me and my family always found the staff at All Saints Surgery professional and helpful.

The doctors and nurses always took great care whilst looking into any problems, as well as all the staff remains friendly and helpful, for which we would like to highly thank them, at least in form of writing a positive review. :)

title: Could be more helpful
body: I would like to thank everyone at this Practice for their care of our aunt and I would particularly like to thank the GP who went above and beyond in everyway possible. Nothing was too much trouble for him and his professionalism, treatment, kindness care and consideration could not have been better. Thank you very much our aunt couldn't have had better care.

title: Dr very gentle and caring nature
body: i could have been dismissed but Dr recognised how worried I am about my condition, she listened, understood, was gentle and caring. got further treatment - now to get through on that telephone line!

title: Helpful staff answer phone
body: I asked if I could have a phone call with a named DR the person I spoke to was very helpful and reassuring.I was able to speak to Dr two hours later.

author: July2022
title: Gastro Enterology consultation
body:
My father was recently admitted to C3 antrim area hospital following a traumatic head injury. He has been having ongoing stomach problems pre admission and a telephone review appointment scheduled with a doctor in July. My father is profoundly deaf in one ear and uses a hearing aid in the other. Since his fall and head injury, his hearing has gotten worse and the hearing aid isn't working as it should. My father is covid positive and I did take the hearing aid to audiology for repair, but it needs to be checked at a time when my father is present to make sure the settings are appropriate. Due to all of this and 3 separate episodes of sickness whilst on the ward, I requested that instead of a telephone consultation, a face to face appointment be facilitated. I asked the nursing staff on the ward, the hospital social worker and I phoned the gastro department directly. None of the gastro secretaries returned my calls and it was very frustrating to get a voicemail, only to be told not to leave a message as the mail box wouldn't be checked. My father has been discharged to a rehab facility with no gastro review. He will have to take a telephone consultation on his own with no family support, and extreme difficulty with his hearing. Given that the message for the future of health care seems to be heavily focused on an integrated approach to care and the trust have a no more silos policy in place, I was extremely disappointed that there couldn't be a collaborative, multi disciplinary approach given to my fathers care. I want to offer my thanks to the nurses on C3 for their patience and compassion in taking time to update me on my fathers care when ever I called. They are extremely professional, caring staff and have a lot to deal with due to covid pressures. I asked for a call from my fathers consultant for an update on his condition, but they never took the time to follow up. I understand they are extremely busy, but given we had no contact with my father due to his covid status, on admission he couldn't update us himself and it created more work for the nurses when they had to follow up with the consultant to answer my questions.  
The lack of communication at consultant level was very frustrating. Given the circumstances I would have thought a caring organisation would have been more emphatic to the situation, instead of taking the view that a telephone consult was scheduled and there could be no flexibility around it.  
**Video of story in BSL **  
This is a translation by a BSL translator  
[https://vimeo.com/835695849](https://vimeo.com/835695849)  
**Video of story in ISL**  
This is a translation by an ISL translator  
[https://vimeo.com/835695898](https://vimeo.com/835695898)

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great service
body: Used e consult and docs got back to me quick about my condition. The doctor very helpful and explained my problem and advised to go into Ed department but after 3 trips into emergency department and sitting there for 18 hours at a time in pain I would rather take my chances at home. I’m sure beacon have a ecg machine as that’s all a&e would of done to me. As I say good service to get back to me after e consult but that’s where it stops thank you.

author: charaqr83
title: My diagnosis
body:
I have a rare disease. I found a hospital in London that specialises in my disease.  
I visited them and was advised by them I could be referred by my GP for treatment. I did this in 2018. I successfully travelled to 2 appointments in 2019 prior to a scheduled operation May 2019.  
Belfast Trust intervened 5 days before the operation and cancelled it... saying it could be done in Belfast. I'm still waiting on this operation. I've had continued deterioration in my face...the operation was to prevent this.  
I've lost faith in my treatment and don't trust the healthcare system... I did everything for first the few years that my consultant asked. I've found that since I've started doing what I want and my consultant has just dropped me.  
I don't know where I am with my care now...  
I'm depressed, anxious and my life is hard due to that decision to cancel that treatment. I feel I've been wronged.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: good service
body:
I had to visit Chaddlewood Practice, for minor surgery.
This was carried out very efficiently,the staff involved were very friendly supportive.
The whole procedure took just a few minutes.

title: Great Practice
body: My Daughter suggested that I sign up with Hawthorns before I moved to Redhill.I must say it was a good suggestion as the service from all the staff has been Exellent.I would also like to say that I have had very good support from the Pharmaceutical department with my changing of drugs.All in all I cannot fault Hawthorns Surgery.Well done all of you.Peter Holman

author: nitratemp98
title: compliments to all staff
body: My compliments to all the staff I met with at the eye clinic this afternoon, 7th July. I was treated with patience and respect for which I was very grateful.

title: Nothing was too much trouble
body: I would like to thank everyone at this Practice for their care of our aunt and I would particularly like to thank the GP who went above and beyond in everyway possible. Nothing was too much trouble for him and his professionalism, treatment, kindness care and consideration could not have been better. Thank you very much our aunt couldn't have had better care.

author: jupiterkj64
title: Care and professional
body: I have been attending the eye clinic for several years. I have had both cataracts sored and I have injection for my macular degeneration. Every time I attend I am treated with care and professionalism. I cannot speak too highly of all the staff in the department of Trelisk Hospital. They all deserve a big hug. Thank You.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I had a sudden medical problem, phoned the surgery and spoke to a Doctor, who advised me to come to the surgery and have a procedure carried out by one of your nurses.  I then had a consultation with the Doctor who advised further investigations which she kindly arranged.

The speed at which I was seen was very much appreciated and both the Doctor and Nurse were extremely kind.

author: pagerzw85
title: Staff were excellent
body: I was admitted to assessment unit last week. Treatment was good as doctor had phoned ahead so had a room ready. Staff were excellent. The downside was getting woken up at 1:00am to be moved to ward 3E. Staff were excellent at 3E and transferred to 3F which has been fine.

author: Elle2
title: Was told there were no gluten-free options
body:
Had informed staff I am wheat intolerant and don't eat dairy. Had asked for suitable foods. Was told there were no gluten-free options and if I wanted soya milk I should go to the shops and buy it  
I was feeling extremely nauseous and hadn't eaten or drank properly for sometime.  
Was then told I should be at home not taking up a bed.very disparaging attitude. Did over hear staff talking about how difficult I was. Not at all professional,or person centred,  
Only a few staff who were at all caring, compassionate or professional.  
Felt very weak and difficult to do anything ,due to not being able to eat and then not having anything I could eat without it increasing gastric pain.  
A previous story on here had a response saying information re different menus/diets were to be provided to wards. Maybe the next stage should be a clear set of instructions for staff to follow.

author: zebratn56
title: Super lovely and reassuring
body:
Dr Davies + Kayleigh  
Super lovely and reassuring Ladies! Talked me through the whole thing and kept me distracted when needed, Thank you very much!

author: Steveo71
title: Seen exactly on time
body: Dermatology department Grantham, was seen exactly on time. They were very friendly and professional! I couldn’t ask for more

author: tucanagb75
title: Excellent experience
body:
Dr Davies + Kayleigh  
Excellent experience both Dr Davies and Kayleigh put me at ease through out having a coil fit.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care is dead-on
body: My care has been absolutely deadens so far with no complaints on my end I can be happy with it. The doctors have been absolutely great and I have had no issues understanding them. The nurses have been central to my care and are all so good at it the work they do is incredible and they work at such a fast pace always knowing what to do and when to do it. They couldn’t be beat they are just great at what they do and are so caring. I have had no issues with my stay at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: I fully recommend this practice.
body:
Beacon Medical is an excellent practice. 
All the staff are very helpful and kind. I find my Gp very knowledgeable, thorough, kind and helpful. I’m fully involved in my care and treatment. I’ve always found the care provided through E Consult very efficient and thorough too. 
I’m very grateful for the care given from the staff at Beacon Medical.

title: Can’t fault them
body: This is predominantly for my own GP who I’m not allowed to name on here. Once you finally get through the econsult I can not fault the attention and contact received. I’ve had ongoing contact from February with my own GP. She’s super efficient, caring and a credit to the practice.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not a single complaint
body: I have been left very happy with my care and I can say I have not a single complaint as the care that I have received has been absolutely brilliant and I am so happy with everything. The nurses have all been pretty good and have so much time for us patients always making sure we are okay. The doctor sari absolutely amazing and have explained absolutely everything to me and answer all my questions. I don’t really enjoy the food it’s not that nice in my opinion. I have had no issues with my care and am more than happy wit be everything I’ve seen

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Don't enjoy the food
body: My care has been pretty alright so far with the only issue that I have had is that I didn't really enjoy the food. I think this is due to personal preference I just don’t enjoy it. The nurses are always great and no matter what time of day they are always so kind and polite. They are very passionate about what they do which makes being in hospital a lot easier. I am as happy with them as they are amazing. The doctors I don’t see as much however they were very good. Every staff member have been excellent and I am happy with my care and have been left with no issues

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body:
I spent 11 hours in a&e long time yes . 
I was amazed all the staff were polite answering any questions I had .The number of people that came in and out all served with kindness and compassion it made the whole experience I wouldn't say pleasant but it made the Time Go really quick I would just like to say a thank you to all the staff that run duty on the 3rd of this month they were amazing all of them also the surgical team with their prompt response and operation the following day everything about my whole experience at the Lister has been one of amazement and I'm sure they don't get enough prayers for the upstanding work that they do

title: Good practice
body: I was contacted by a GP, not my named one , with reference to a low haemoglobin on a recent blood test. After a thorough examination I was asked to go to Derriford Hospital for further care.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nursing is at a different level
body: My care has been very good so far and I have been left very happy with the care that I have received. The nursing has been at a different level with what they do being absolutely great. They are so kind and do everything they can to make sure that I am all okay. The doctors have been well and truly great devising an excellent treatment plan and explaining everything to me so well. The food has been amazing so far I love every meal. I have had absolutely no issue in my care and have been more than impressed with it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Disgraceful service
body:
I phoned the surgery yesterday afternoon to book an appointment due to having heart palpitations and other symptoms concerning my heart. The response was to phone back tomorrow due to them not accepting any future appointments.

I then phoned back this morning at 8am (the earliest you can call the surgery) to arrange an on-the-day appointment. AskMyGP was unavailable as it always is. I told the receptionist that I had been told to make this appointment and she, instead, informed me that a doctor would give me a call-back at some point today. I therefore waited at home all day for this call for nothing to happen. I called them back at 5pm to chase the phone call up and was told that I was on the list and could expect a call by the time the surgery closed at 8:30pm. I'm not sure how I could be so far down the list after I was one of the first to phone them this morning and I am sure that more than one doctor works at Sleaford. I continued to wait for this call but it never came.

This concerns my heart; I would imagine this should be prioritised due to it being a fairly serious issue. I am disgusted by the level of service I have received from Sleaford Medical Group and this is certainly not the first time I have been let down by this centre and am very much looking forward to changing practices.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses incredible
body: My care has been absolutely amazing so far and I am so happy with the care that I have received in the hospital as it has been absolutely incredible so far. The nurses have all been absolutely incredible and are always there to make sure I am all okay and have had absolutely no issues. All the staff in fact are so kind and I am so happy with all the care that they have given me. I have been able to understand them so easily due to how clearly and informative they talk. I have had no issues at all and am very happy with my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: turkeyej39
title: Angels of the North
body:
Dear Ladies,  
Goodness me! How many time have I injured myself these past two years - a slip, a trip, injured myself in my workshop; or just a plain fall, each time has been responded to immediately -- five times, eight, ten?? and each time multiply by four visits to mend the injury.  
Thankyou ladies, Angels of the North.  
Sincerely,

title: Excellent Service
body:
I had an MRI on my back last Wednesday, 3 August.  Previous experience of an NHS MRI had left me very fearful.  However, the staff at Heath Lodge were wonderful, taking time to address my fears with empathy and kindness.  Without their kindness I know this would have been a much more challenging experience.  
Without doubt I am happy to recommend the services of this clinic.
Thank you again to all the staff who cared for me so well.

readBy.name: The Royal Orthopaedic Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very helpful and supportive
body:
For over 2 years I have suffered with a work related problem. The help and support I’ve had from everyone at Beacon, Mudge Way has been exceptional. It took a great toll on my health and my GP has gone above and beyond to offer care and advice and is still helping after conclusion of problem.
Thank you all

title: Appointment system is impossible
body: I very rarely need to visit the GP and to be honest the last time I wanted to was 3 years ago.  I am shocked by how very difficult it is to make an appointment.  Only being able to phone at 08.00 or 12 noon to make a same day phone call with a GP is appalling.   I work 08.00 to 16.00 Mon to Fri and my breaks are not at those times so as I am not available at either of those very specific times.   I am excluded from health care unless the medical issue should be something that takes me out of work.   Life was so much better when for none emergency matters you could ring any time of day and book an in person appointment for a time that was convenient  and that you could actually make.

author: travellerwx66
title: Best time I have been in hospital
body: I can't say I enjoyed being in hospital - no one likes being ill. But having said that, it was by far the best time I have been in hospital, the staff were great, the food was very nice. Loads of choice and well served. I was attended to 24/7 for every need you could imagine. I have definitely no complaints - first class 10/10.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: All the staff are great
body: My care has been amazing so far and I have been left so happy with my care. The doctors have been amazing so far and gave me very clear explanations which has helped me understand my treatment. The nurses are some of the best about and I honestly think that they couldn’t be better they are that good. The work they do is incredible and they always put the patient first. All the staff are great even people such as the domestics do a great job. I have had no issues at all and am happy enough with everything

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses are top tier
body: My care has been absolutely brilliant so far and I honestly don’t think that I could complain about anything in the hospital so far as everything has been 100 percent. The nurses really are top tier and I don’t think that there could be better in charge of my care. All of them come in and work so hard despite being incredibly busy, they are incredible at what they do. The doctors have been great so far and I am able to understand most of what they say. The foods alright could be better but what can you do. There are no issues at all and I am happy enough in the hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good information
body: Attending both the assessment and actual operation was done very efficiently and was informative as to my treatment.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Kindness of the staff
body: My care has been amazing so far and I have been left so happy with all of it. Due to the kindness of the staff I have been left with absolutely no complaints in the hospital. The food has been pretty decent and can’t find a fault with it. The nurses have been really good and I know they are always there in the event that I may need something which I appreciate. The doctors are amazing and have helped me understand the excellent treatment plan that they have devised. I have had absolutely no issues at all and am happy with the care I’ve had

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Christchurch - waste of time
body: My follow up appointment at Christchurch in May was cancelled (due to the changeover). Nobody thought to tell me and it was shut when I got there. I made another appointment and after attending was told to book another for treatment, which I duly did. I was late for the appointment due to traffic and had to wait 20 minutes which was fair enough. However, I was then told that Christchurch no longer carry out treatment so another wasted journey. Told me I would have to go to Dorchester. I have no way to get there so have now been referred to Bournemouth Hospital for treatment. I feel confident they will provide the efficient service which has been sadly lacking at CHEC. I just wish I had been referred there in the first place!

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses have done a good job
body: My care has been pretty good so far and I feel like I have recovered alright since I was admitted into the hospital. The nurses have done a very good job which has made the care excellent, They are so kind and are always there to help us patients out. The doctors have been amazing and come round every day to make sure I am up to date and are very clear and concise. The food has been pretty good and thanks to everyone I have been left with no issues at all

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thanks
body:
I’ve just had a very positive appointment with one of the GPs & also gained more of an insight into how hard everyone is working. Just wanted to thank all of the staff for their endurance in challenging times. I don’t think anyone goes into this line of work without genuinely wanting to help people. 
It’s a changing environment for all practices, sometimes there are frustrations in adapting to change. I can be quick to complain about things not working, so wanted to highlight some of those that I think are working well at the practice. 
Digital services overall are responsive & efficient. E reception particularly can be counted as a success. 
Over the past year, my experience calling reception has much improved & staff have been consistently helpful.
I was initially apprehensive about a pharmacist, rather than a doctor, carrying out my annual medication review. The pharmacist took the time to explain the benefits &, in actuality, it was thorough & comprehensive.

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very pleasant to be looked after in my own home
body: Excellent service very reassuring to be looked after in my own home - with my daughter present - by lovely people who took time & trouble to care.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thank you
body: I would like to say thank you to the whole team for being so kind.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Lee Barlow
title: Accessing services and general care
body:
The nurses in the Rushcliffe area of Nottingham have helped me with the last 15 years of my life after suffering a high level spinal injury.. they have delivered exceptional care and guidance throughout and to be perfectly honest I wouldn’t be here without them. They have shown nothing but a professional way of working. Most importantly if I’m having a bad day they will always come in with a smile on there faces and cheer me up in some way.  
Basically my district nurses are all awesome!

author: izardk95
title: helpful people working very hard
body:
Overall I have found that the health care services have been much better than I could imagine - apart from my local doctors. A lot of very dedicated and helpful people working very hard to do the best for me.  
Thank you.

author: capellanf55
title: Fantastic experience
body: Had a great experience with inclusion from start to finish with my key worker Simon. I have been offered me a placement in rehab which I desperately needed, he recognised that I needed it from there I took part in six weekly sessions on zoom with my care manager Grant who was fantastic in preparing us all for what life was going to be like in rehab having had some of these tips some people decided rehab was not for them others like my self carried on till the end of the course and was given a placement in rehab which was a fantastic experience for me and that after care has been amazing which has seen well needed so total amazing experience thankyou.

title: Extremely High Quality care
body: I attended the Kendal Spamedica and was immediately impressed with the overall way the receptionist, nurses and medical staff treat me. The explaining of the procedure was excellent. Immediately put at ease.

author: zebraef78
title: Excellent service
body:
I have to say I found the services provided by the rapid response team in Gransha excellent. They were very pro-active and communicative in getting my bloods done, which has proven to be difficult through the GP since the pandemic. RR were easy to get them done and I didn't have to chase the results - they were straight on the phone to arrange my follow up treatment and plan ahead.  
Thanks again.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: wearingjs77
title: Hospital home team were caring
body: Last week I had a kidney infection and I was not very well. I rand my doctor and he sent the hospital at home team out and they were absolutely brilliant. They got me sorted in a few days and I did not have to go to A and E. They are a very caring team and I hope this practice can be kept gonig and extended. It saves people having to go into hospital and they can get better quicker among there own family.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses are so helpful
body: My care has been brilliant so far and I am so happy with the fact that I have had absolutely no issues with my hospital. The doctors have been the best of the best and thanks to them I am feeling better and understand my treatment. The nurses have been great and are always so kind. They are also incredibly helpful and are always on hand to get me anything that I need. I am as grateful for them as they are amazing. The food has been pretty well I can’t really complain about anything as I have been treated well and have had no issues.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Have had no issues
body: My care has been very good and I am very happy with all the treatment that I have been given so far. The nurses that look after me on a daily basis are some of the best individuals that I have seen they are all absolutely incredible and go out of their way to ensure that us patients are all okay. The doctors are the best and are always there to explain everything. I am disappointed in the fact I have to go through surgery and the fact it keeps getting delayed which has led to me fasting often. When I have had food it has been pretty good I honestly enjoy it. I have had no issues and am happy with my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
Easy to book an appointment on the day, pleasant reception staff.
Was examined thoroughly, a test was taken to be sent off to see if medication was required. Very good experience.

author: Kmac2901
title: Quick and easy
body: I attended at Forth Valley Hospital in order to have a mole removed from my back. Procedure quick and easy with no issues. Thanks to David, Alisha and Chris for their help.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care is 10/10
body: I cannot have any complaints with my care as it has honestly been 10/10 and there is not a single bad word I could say about any of the staff that have looked after me. The doctors are all great and when they come round they are very clear speaking and aim it at my level so I can understand. The nurses are always great and are always so nice towards us patients which I appreciate a lot. They are always on hand to answer questions and make sure that everyone un the hospital is okay. I have had no issues whatsoever with my care and am happy with it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Passionate staff are incredible
body: My care has been very good so far and that is thanks to the staff which are so dedicated team and so passionate about their jobs which is something I know I appreciate seeing how happy their job makes them and the fact they honestly enjoy their job and enjoy helping us patients. The nurses are all very good and do an incredible job. They are so kind and help put so much in order to deliver us an excellent level of care. I am happy with all my care and give the staff 10/10

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The nurses continue to be great
body: My care has been pretty excellent so far and I am happy with all the care that I have received. I have had absolutely no issues with my care and have been very impressed by it. The nurses have been and continue to be great they are absolutely incredible and I cannot complain about a single on of them. The doctors are the same and provide me with great explanations so I understand all of them and everything about my future treatment. Everything has been great and I am happy with everything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thorough and professional
body: Met with a wonderful doctor this morning who took the time to take a full history,  asked pertinent questions,  did a thorough examination and provided clear next steps and guidance. Gold star doctoring. Practice manager is really effective and responsive. The best GP surgery around.

author: turkeywt37
title: I would say the help I received was invaluable.
body: I had a heart attack years ago and was told I had heart failure. Just before last Christmas I was taken into hospital due to heart problems. I was referred to your service and was more than pleased with the service I received. The set back - I had took some time to get over and I think I lost confidence. Melissa, the nurse sent to me, was not only able to reassure me that all was going ok but it was going to be a lot of time before I was used to some sort of normality. This reassurance was very welcome at the time and helped me regain confidence. Walking is something I enjoy and have now been able to resume this pleasure. I found the reassurance Melissa was able to give me was important to my recovery - I would say the help I received was invaluable.

author: leopardee97
title: Medical needs always prioritized
body: My overall experience with Rapid Response has been positive. The staff are courteous and professional in all aspects of their work; their caring nature is evident first thing in the morning and last thing at night. I have full confidence in the delivery of the service + feel reassured if I have any concerns. The 'hub' in Gransha Grounds is run very efficiently with my medical needs always prioritized.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body: Daughter was suffering from stomach pains was invited  into surgery were excellent service was given. Next day Doctor rang to see whether further treatment was needed. Excellent service

author: JaneN22
title: First class service
body: I was referred to the Breast Clinic at Gartnavel Hospital due to discomfort in my breast. I was taken on time, thoroughly examined by a consultant who then sent me for a mammogram. At x-ray I was put at ease, it was uncomfortable but the entire process explained to me. After mammogram image 5 I returned to Clinic 3 where after a short wait I was sent back to x-ray for clearer images of one area in particular. After that I had an ultrasound and finally saw the consultant again who reported all was well. A thoroughly professional and slick process. I received the best of care and was out in three hours. This one stop clinic is best practice. Thank you.

author: stitchlover19
title: Good Experience at RH hospital
body:
I went to urgent care yesterday after being recommended by my doctor. I was in a lot of pain and was seen very quickly. The nurse who did my triage was lovely, taking my additional needs into consideration. I was taken round to A + E due t the pain and wasn't left waiting for long. The staff who treated me were so kind and understanding of my additional needs and made me feel at ease, as I was able to understand what the treatment outcome was and was treated quite quickly with IV fluids.  
I can't fault any of the staff for how they carried out their care with me. They let my mom stay with me the whole time and were happy with the care provided.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff were working their hardest
body:
Came into accident and emergency and it was very very busy. The wait was long but that is to be expected with all the people there. The waiting room was full and had to wait a while on a bed. The care was fine, it sort of felt like they wanted you out of their hair as soon as possible.  
The staff were working their hardest to try and get everyone seen to as soon as possible but, you can tell they are stressed out.  
Female surgical is good I cannot complain about it at all. The food is decent and the place is clean, that is all I really care about. The only thing that is annoying is the toilets and showers are so far away and you sometimes have to wait since they are being used.  
The staff here are the best, they always look to be enjoying their job and are willing to have the craic with you which I like. They keep me in the loop of what is happening with my care and my results.  
Overall, very happy with everything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They take good care of me
body:
Accident and emergency was fine from what I remember, I cannot really comment on it as I was very delirious.  
Female surgical has been good, they take good care of me, and I am already feeling better. The environment is clean, tidy and everything seems to be in order. The food is decent and the menu has great variety.  
The staff are lovely up here and so approachable if I need anything. They try their best and explain everything to me so I know what is happening. They are the best.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: februarypb78
title: Care and attention was 100%
body:
First of all, I can't rate all the staff both doctors and nurses high enough at clinic 3 Fractural clinic at  
Altnagelvin hospital from the moment I arrived at the clinic I was treated with the highest care. I can't thank nurse assistant Jacqueline enough and Also sisters Sandra highly enough the Care and attention I received was 100% and big thank you also to Mr M'Cormick.  
Many thanks.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Awful mental health support
body: I have seen this practice go downhill recently but I had great hope when I was told they now had a mental health practitioner. I was so relieved as thought finally I would have an appointment with someone who is professionally trained to help me in a specialist are. How wrong I was! I only managed 1 appointment as I was so shocked by the way this 'professional ' conducted the appointment and just flapped and just waffled on and on and on. My goodness she loves to talk. She was all over the place and it made me wonder what qualifications and experience does she actually have?. I declined a further appointment as was left so confused as I don't think this so called professional is actually  qualified.  What a waste of money having that level of service! My advice would be to get rid!

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: You will never go hungry
body:
Accident and emergency was fine the longest bit was the wait on a bed. The results also took a while after the tests were done. I find it odd they do a covid test on you but you will not get the results for a good while, it stresses me out in case I am near someone that has it and does not know they have it. Accident and emergency is a stressful place with things happening all the time and constant.  
The staff there are so nice, they have so much pressure on them, their job definitely for the faint hearted with the things they see. They do not judge you for anything probably because they have seen it all.  
Female surgical has been standard, the care is very good though. The environment is fine, lighting, noise the whole lot. The food is good also, there is plenty on the plate, and you will never go hungry.  
The staff are lovely, they are definitely stressed out though, with the amount of people they are looking after and all the jobs they have to do.  
I am happy with everything and especially the care I am receiving.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Satisfied patient
body:
I had very severe allergic reaction from an insect bite and was seen by one of the GP's who prescribed medication and within a week of using the medication, I was better. I was seen promptly and members of staff were very friendly and helpful.
Happy with my overall experience at the practice.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are so kind hearted and lovely
body:
Accident and emergency was fine it went quick enough just annoying no one can come with you to pass the time.  
The staff are lovely and kind, that is all I can say.  
Female surgical is a lovely ward, having a side ward is a nice add on cannot complain about it. The ward is clean and I like having control of the TV for myself.  
The staff are so kind hearted and lovely. They are so friendly and open to us. They tell me everything and make sure I understand and allow me to ask any questions I have.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: natashap
title: Staff have been brilliant
body:
Staff have been brilliant, I have no complaints at all. Would have liked to be able to smoke.  
Food was excellent. Facilities are good, would have been nice to have more activities during the day.

author: Blooddonor123
title: Blood donation
body:
I felt a little like there wasn’t much chat today during my donation. Or explanation of what was happening.
I have donated several times before but normally get more chat . As your stuck on a bed for up to ten min a bit of chit chat can be welcome- sometiems I don’t like cht but maybe a ‘ would you like to chat or sit quietly!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: pepperkr86
title: Birth
body: Had my baby last year, lockdown was coming to an end. I was in active labour in the delivery suite waiting on hubby to get here but also about to have my baby. 1 midwife was fantastic, the other wasn’t. They told me to be quiet, they were also trying to take the gas & air out of my hand. Hubby was banging to get in but no one let him until after I delivered. I was left on the bed for over an hour and half. We had buzzed for getting some milk for baby and also wanting baby weighed etc. Had to buzz a few times for the midwife to come back. They had put in my notes that my husband was verbally aggressive towards them when he couldn’t get in. But he wasn’t. He just said it was a disgrace. Also whilst being taken back down to the ward 1 staff member said to the other that they were so short staffed. It felt like it was a dig towards us as hubby didn’t get in on time. I get it that it can be short staffed, but where were staff manners? We weren’t being rude or nothing.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cloakers
title: The staff were fantastic
body: I was at DGRI this morning for an Appointment to see about a knee replacement ~ the Staff in the Orthopaedics Department were fantastic, the care , the Attitide etc etc i was shown could not have been better~~ i would like to say a big thank you to all

author: JMJ-22
title: My time on George Earle ward
body:
I was brought into Torbay Hospital by my wife following a suspected TIA, as there were no ambulances available. I was triaged immediately and TIA confirmed by Doctors. I was given clot busting drugs, 2 CT scans and transferred to Bay 4 on George Earle Ward.  
The care I was given was second to one and nothing was too much trouble for the Nurses, HCAs and ancillary staff. I was overwhelmed by the care, compassion and attention that patients were given during my stay. Both HCAs Ron & Lea nd the two ladies who wre on duty on Saturday night stood out from the rest.  
The care I observed for other patients was also was exemplary. These people clearly deserve to be recognised.  
Thank you for looking after me during my four-day stay. Miss you already.

title: Really good service
body:
In this particular instance, I sent a message via email as my mum was ill. Within a few hours a doctor had called me and taken details. He then went away to consult another GP and then called back to advise us how to proceed. You couldn't really ask for a better service than that. 

More generally, the practice is efficiently run and the doctors have been, without fail, kind and caring, and have speedily made referrals and recommendations when needed. They have often called me to discuss how mum is getting on. I can't really fault their dedication.

Recently I sent this short email to the team there by way of thanks:

"I just wanted to say I big thank you to you all for the courtesy and efficiency and quality of your service - both medical and front desk.

Today was just one example of many where it was exemplary. 

Please do pass this on to all parties - and do let me know if there is an ‘official’ way I can thank and commend you.

Kindest regards,

James"

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Hospice health care assistant
body:
The care assistant Nairobi was amazing from start to finish. For my friend who is at the hospice, she (Nairobi) really looks after them very gently, is helpful and always chatting and making them smile. For our visit she was polite and smiling and making us tea. Very nice lady who is very sweet and caring. Thank you for all your efforts and service.  
Anything that could be improved:  
The covid tests should or could be reduced to 15 minutes instead of 30 minutes.

title: Helpful staff
body: All the staff have been really helpful when I called - reception and GP and I know how pressured everyone is at the moment. Thank you

author: Susan C
title: I was informed that I'd had a heart attack
body:
I began being very sick with terrible heartburn. Knew somerhing wasn't right.  
Paramedics were great & quickly got me to hospital.  
Was informed I'd had a heart attack, such a shock!!The nursing staff on Ward 6C were amazing, lovely ladies who were helpful and encouraging. Nothing was a problem for them, they went above and beyond my expectations.I was a bit disappointed with one doctor. It felt like they werent very interested, they weren't keen to come into the room and tended to stand in the doorway. It wasn't easy to ask questions.

title: Great service
body: There are so many negative comments about GPs but I had a really good experience this week.  I phoned the surgery as soon as it was open and was third in the queue.  I waited less than 5 minutes before I spoke to a very helpful receptionist.  I was given  a face to face appointment with the doctor that same morning.  She listened to what I had to say and now have a blood test booked for next week.  I would give this practice 5 gold stars.

author: hydramz65
title: Water birth in the MLU
body: I couldn’t say enough about the care from start to finish in the maternity unit Daisy Hill. We were lucky enough to be able to have a water birth in the MLU. Midwives Margaret & Tara were amazing and made us feel so relaxed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: PhilChris
title: Two Brilliantly Talented Nurses
body: I was in terrible pain after CABG x 4 and was offered diclofenac, via the route where you don't have to swallow! A somewhat embarrassing option so I started making suggestions, light a candle, maybe dinner first, does this mean we're engaged? The two nurses Ewelina and Jackie appreciated the lightened mood and Ewelina commented that she'd needed that, I think meaning a release from the tension from constantly working at capacity and beyond, providing the finest of care. Ewelina is helping Jackie to become another brilliant, dedicated nurse. Both helped me with everything I needed when I was at my lowest ebb, Jackie built me up. Both are multi-lingual with Jackie speaking 8 languages! Is that even possible? So what I feel is this absolute power duo should be recognized for their professional brilliance and dedication. I personally witnessed both speaking to non-English speakers to improve their quality of care. So come on NHS let's celebrate this success, not over work staff, and let's celebrate their brilliance when we can!

title: Wonderful Service
body:
2 weeks ago I suffered from gastroenteritis and contacted the surgery after 4 days of illness having lost a stone in weight. The response was immediate as well as caring and I was booked in for a blood test the results of which were received on the same day with clear advice. I cannot comment the Practice enough for showing concern and real
Professionalism.
I have been with the Practice for many years and have always received a friendly and focused response.

author: Cormac
title: My trip to A&E
body: I’d just like to say on record my thanks to the nurses an doctor at the heartlands A&E, Major all the way to ward 11 who carried on my care before being discharged, you all went above an beyond for the uniform to make me feel comfy

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: bravoye35
title: Cyst removal
body: Yesterday I had appointment to get a cyst removed from under arm. On checking the area at hospital they discovered there was another one so David and alisha removed both. They made me feel so welcome and at ease. David was so funny with his jokes. . Told me everything that was going to happen what he was doing. Gave me advice on wound care. Used dissolving stitches so I wouldn't need to go back for removal.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: lyraze43
title: Friendly and professional staff
body:
I attended with possible epididymitis. Pain in left testicle leading towards the bladder, but minimal pain later in the week. I was checked out and had all my tests done.  
Very friendly and professional staff, I felt totally at ease.

title: Amazing staff and care
body:
Thanks to all involved in treating me after my accident yesterday in the Dales. The ambulance crew were amazing as were all the departments treating me for my injuries. 

Really impressed by the kindness and care given to what was a stressful time for me. Darlington you are very lucky to have such a great hospital. 

Thanks Again
Kevin.

title: Brilliant Doctor
body: The GP I saw face to face for my condition was brilliant. She was kind, listened actively, interested in my concerns, thoughtful and thorough in her assessment. She responded to my query very quickly. I wish there were more doctors like her!

title: Unfit for purpose
body:
First of all, to the reviewer, please do not respond with a statement that begins with "we are sorry to hear that....".  Remember, this is not a complaint, this is a review, you've had your chance to put things right but you've chosen not to take that opportunity, so please don't publicly patronize me with hollow apologies. Thankyou in advance.

Originally I was signposted to this service by my gp for cfs/me symptoms.

It took 3 assessments and the best part of a year just to get 6 sessions of cbt for anxiety.  At my third assessment, after an hour of telling my health story for the third time, the assessor said "so how can we help you?".  3 hours spread over 3 sessions over a year and some clown says "So how can we help you?".  By definition, that is not an assessment or triage, that's just lazy.

I honestly don't understand why I was signposted to this service for cfs/me.  I did express this to 2 people at the Well-being service but they refused to say that my GP was wrong in his signposting.

As a result, the 6 cbt sessions I received had nothing to do with my health issues, these sessions made my condition considerably worse.

A year later I was diagnosed with asc by the NeuroBehavioural service, and they also signposted me to the Well-being service.  In the meantime I had been locked in an e-mail battle (17 multi-paragraph e-mails spread over a year is a battle) with the well-being service and had 2 more assessments from them.

I was offered more cbt, which I grabbed with both hands, by this point I had lost my job and was beyond desperate.

This time I recieved about 26 sessions.  Again, they felt like they had nothing to do with my health issues.  They even tried to convince me that my "I've always felt different to other people" statement is a 'core negative belief' or somesuch, in other words, wrong.  Imagine saying that to someone who has struggled all their life with differences and has just been diagnosed with autism, and has become physically ill because of their autism.

The same therapist also made me draw a life timeline.  I did explain that I didn't need to do this, that I'd already done this, but they insisted.  This exercise upset me considerably for several months, the Therapist did nothing with my timeline, they said it was for my benefit!

After my sessions, I spoke to the clinical lead, and they told me that I was wrong, that the therapy I received had not made me worse but had in fact improved my health therefore they will not be offering me further sessions to undo the harm caused.  Nothing could be further from the truth.

It seems inappropriate to me that gp’s and specialists are signposting patients with complex health issues to the wellbeing service.  The wellbeing service by their own admission are not trained to deal with complex health issues.

title: Ist time attendance- fantastic experience
body: How refreshing! Very helpful, smiling receptionists, relaxing atmosphere in waiting room, seen on time by both nurse and doctor who were again very pleasant and helpful. 1st time at this GP practice - wish I had changed GPs ages ago!  Excellent!!

author: leathertg37
title: Severe abdominal pain episode
body:
I had severe lower left hand side abdominal pain during the night. I took paracetamol and nurofen which had no effect on the pain. I could not get comfortable in any position.  
I phoned 111 in the morning and then I had a call from my doctors surgery with an appointment.  
The doctor in the surgery was excellent and he gave me a referral letter to go straight to the Surgical Assessment Ward 15 at Stoke Mandeville. I had my ops done and a blood test. There was a long delay until I was seen by a doctor. They questioned me on my symptoms and then administered painkillers, and said they would come back to me in 5 minutes. Several hours later another doctor called me in to a room. Was not aware that I had already been seen. I’m still waiting to be seen by a senior doctor. I have never felt so invisible and poorly treated in my life. I am very disappointed by my treatment. I hope no one else is treated in this way.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: MrO 54
title: Service at Dorchester General Hospital
body:
All my appointments were on time and all the staff were excellent, efficient, friendly and helpful.  
I had 3 appointments for X-ray and consultation on a fractured fibula. First appointment in May 2022, follow up appointment in June 2022 and final appointment in August 2022.  
My concern is that I saw a different consultant for each appointment. Although each subsequent consultant could read the notes and see the X-rays, I would have thought it preferable to have the same consultant who would have followed the treatment from beginning to end. This would, I’m sure, be better for the consultant who would have the satisfaction of seeing their work progressing, building a relationship with the patient and the eventual positive outcome. It would certainly be better for the patient who would have the confidence that a consultant was following the progress of the treatment, had sufficient knowledge of the malady and could also build a mutually beneficial relationship.  
Frankly, in my opinion, I receive a more consistent and personal service when I take my dog to the vet, visit a hairdresser or shop at my local store. Surely this cannot be a good way of approaching something as important as health care?

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Gemwad
title: Caring and compassion from the IBD helpline
body:
I've been under the care of the GI team at the WGH, Edinburgh for many years.  
Recently I have had to contact the IBD helpline on numerous occasions for advice and support on managing a flare of a chronic bowel condition. Despite the ongoing pressures within the NHS my telephone calls have always been responded to within 24 hours.  
The nurse specialists who run the helpline have been so caring, compassionate and understanding. I have always felt listened to and my treatment preferences respected.  
When medications have required adjusting or new ones added in they have contacted my GP for me to arrange same day prescriptions. They have phoned me on several occasions over the last few months to check how I am and arrange further follow up.  
The care provided by Janice, Anna and the rest of the team is excellent and their services are so vital to their patients. Thank you for all your help over the years but especially the last few months!

author: Cliff Bigsbh
title: The doctor put me at ease
body:
It had been a few years since I had visited my doctor, and thought that I should probably go and get myself checked up on just to be on the safe side. I also wanted to get some things addressed, as I have a family history with a lot of potential things being passed down, and wanted to make sure I was healthy.  
The doctor spoke to me about all my concerns, and helped put me at ease in terms of my physical health. A rash had suddenly appeared this morning on my right hand, which sparked my desire to speak to someone, and again, gave a good explanation and didn't think it was anything serious.  
Then, I brought up my anxiety issues, how that’s been affecting me, and I got good advice, some links on where to get help with that, and to follow up in a few weeks

author: taurusdp36
title: Doctor is a really good listener, always patient and reassuring
body: Dr Ferrabee has been providing care for myself and for my children as part of his work at the Nightingale Practice. I have recently had several consultations with him. He is a really good listener, always patient and reassuring. He also explains his decision making process and the rationale for his recommendations which is really helpful and reassuring.
